result.execSummary:
The defendant Lawrence T Winters was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine and costs to be paid in full by 01-16-2023 or penalty of civil judgment entered for non payment.

Costs to be paid with fine payment.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all restitution/costs/fees, and no new law violations.  The defendant shall file a petition with the Court to verify the successful completion of the sentence.
Court orders 9 mm Sarsilmaz handgun seized at time of arrest to be forfeited per Sec 968.20(1m)(b), Wis. Stats. for Waukesha City Police Department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lawrence T Winters

records.addlTxt:
11:54 AM Defendant Lawrence T Winters in court.  Attorney Morgan Risseeuw in court for Lawrence T Winters.  Prosecuting attorney Alyssa M Jay in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case called for plea and sentencing.
Court conducts plea colloquy.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty. 
Recommendations by the State.  Recommendations by the Defense.  Statement by the defendant.

The Court Orders the Following:

Count 1:
Court orders 9 mm Sarsilmaz handgun seized at time of arrest to be forfeited per Sec 968.20(1m)(b), Wis. Stats. 

FINE: $ 379.00
	
DNA Surcharge: $ 200.00

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
 
Total costs/fine/forfeiture: to be paid by 1/16/23.   Failure to pay: will result in a civil judgment.

Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all restitution/costs/fees, and no new law violations.  The defendant shall file a petition with the Court to verify the successful completion of the sentence.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 25, 2022 at 11:30 am.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

11:15 AM Attorney Glenn Gaskill for Morgan Risseeuw in court for Lawrence T Winters.  Prosecuting attorney Alyssa M. Schaller in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appears by authorization. 
Defense requests plea and sentencing date.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 21, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Authorization to appear received and filed.

Case called at 10:36 AM 
District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Lawrence T Winters in court with attorney Glen Gaskill for attorney Morgan Risseeuw. 
Attorney Gaskill requests another hearing date.  Court grants.  Hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms. (EXCEPTION: The defendant can use/possess weapons for the SOLE purpose of taking a firearm class for CCW).

08:29 AM Defendant Lawrence T Winters in court with attorney Morgan Risseeuw.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 10:30 am.

The court recalls the matter at 08:34 AM with the same appearances.
Attorney Winters states that the Defendant is enrolled in a CCW class.
The Court will amended the signatture bond.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
